definition[0]: to behave in the way that most other people in your group or society behave
example[0]: the pressure on schoolchildren to conform
example[1]: people who do not conform to traditional standards of behaviour
definition[1]: to obey a law, rule etc
example[2]: Students can be expelled for refusing to conform to school rules.
example[3]: All new buildings must conform with the regional development plan.
example[4]: products which conform to international safety standards
definition[2]: to obey a law or rule
example[5]: The website owner must conform with the requirements of the Data Protection Act.
example[6]: The property conformed to all the latest building regulations.
